intro: Amyris oleosa, commonly known as the Japanese sandarac tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Japan and Korea. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap, which has been historically used in various traditional applications. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters, with smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or yellow, and arranged in clusters, often blooming in spring. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
